alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 8:01PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Moffat County through 830 PM MDT... At 801 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 35 miles southeast of Squaw Hollow Boat Ramp On Flaming Gorge to 52 miles south of Bitter Creek Rest Area to 49 miles west of Baggs to 43 miles northeast of Dinosaur to 33 miles northeast of Rangely. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Powder Wash, Hiawatha, Sunbeam and Sparks. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 41 and 53. Colorado 318 between mile markers 40 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin
